lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau sirqw jlu kwstih n borq; krq icq lwj ApnoeI pRiqpwirE hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as the water of streams and rivers does not sink the wood, it (water) has the shame of the fact that it has irrigated and brought the wood up;

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ Pyr ndI dw jl kwT nUM nhIˆ fobdw, qy ies g`l dI lwj Srm ic`q AMdr krdw hY ik ieh kwT Awpxw hI Es dw pwilAw vfIirAw hoXw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau krq suq Aink ieAwn pn; qaU n jnnI Avgun aurDwirE hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a son commits many mistakes but his mother who has given him birth never recounts them (she still keeps loving him).

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: Pyr ijs qrHwˆ puqR Anykwˆ A\wxqweIAwˆ krdw hY pr jnnI mwˆ Es dy AOguxwˆ nUM Awpxy irdy AMdr nhIˆ hI ilAwXw krdI[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau srMn sUr pUrn prqigAw rwKY; lK AprwD kIey mwir n ibfwirE hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a culprit who may have myriad vices is not killed by a brave warrior in whose refuge he may have come, the warrior protects him and thus fulfils his virtuous traits.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ Pyr sUrmw iksy nUM Srx ley dI pUrI pRiqgÎw inbOˆhdw hY qy Anigxq ApRwD BI Es dy q`k ky aus nUM mwr nhIˆ is`itAw krdw[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI prm gur pwrs prs giq; isKn ko ikrq krmu kCU n bIcwirE hY [536[

Unknown.translation: Similarly the supreme benevolent True Guru does not dwell on any of the faults of His Sikhs. He is like touch of philosopher-stone (True Guru removes dross of the Sikhs in His refuge and makes them gold-like precious and pure).   (536)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqsI pRkwr hI gurU prm pwrs pwrswˆ dy pwrs dy sprS dI AYsI gqI rIqI hY, ik is`Kwˆ dI krm krqUq bwbq kuC BI vIcwr nhIˆ kirAw krdy ]536]
